page.title: 14Landscape
page.content: We walked South from South Lodge to identify trees and land use on managed woodlands. To the right of the lane was an area where the trees had been felled and replanted with Larch and Oak now three years old. Piles of timber were stacked along the lane. Beyond this in 14 Acre Rough there was a plantation of oak trees 15-20 years old. Light could penetrate between these trees and there was undergrowth of bluebells and grass. In this area were pheasant pens. Next was an area of planted fir trees, larch and Scots pine. They grew taller than the telegraph poles which stood among them and grew close together, letting little light onto the forest floor, where there was little undergrowth. Along the lane there were horse-chestnuts and yew trees growing.
